meta.content: Korean Journal of Chemical Engineering - Zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 was prepared and used as catalyst for the solventless synthesis of cyclic carbonate from CO2 and propylene oxide with...
meta.name: twitter:description

meta.content: Cycloaddition of carbon dioxide with propylene oxide using zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 as a catalyst
meta.name: dc.title

meta.content: Korean Journal of Chemical Engineering 2017 34:3
meta.name: dc.source

meta.content: 2017 Korean Institute of Chemical Engineers, Seoul, Korea
meta.name: dc.copyright

meta.content: Zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 was prepared and used as catalyst for the solventless synthesis of cyclic carbonate from CO2 and propylene oxide with or without TBAB co-catalyst. ZIF-23 catalysts were prepared by a solvothermal or microwave method and they were characterized by various physicochemical techniques such as XRD, FT-IR, BET, TGA, and FE-SEM. The effects of reaction parameters such as temperature, reaction time, CO2 pressure, and co-catalyst on the reactivity of catalyst were investigated. ZIF-23 was recyclable up to four times without any considerable loss of its initial activity. Reaction mechanism containing the role of ZIF-23 with TBAB co-catalyst was also proposed.

meta.content: Cycloaddition of carbon dioxide with propylene oxide using zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 as a catalyst - Korean Journal of Chemical Engineering

Zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 was prepared and used as catalyst for the solventless synthesis of cyclic carbonate from CO2 and propylene oxide with or without TBAB co-catalyst. ZIF-23 catalysts were prepared by a solvothermal or microwave method and they were characterized by various physicochemical techniques such as XRD, FT-IR, BET, TGA, and FE-SEM. The effects of reaction parameters such as temperature, reaction time, CO2 pressure, and co-catalyst on the reactivity of catalyst were investigated. ZIF-23 was recyclable up to four times without any considerable loss of its initial activity. Reaction mechanism containing the role of ZIF-23 with TBAB co-catalyst was also proposed.

head.title: Cycloaddition of carbon dioxide with propylene oxide using zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 as a catalyst | SpringerLink

div.div: Cycloaddition of carbon dioxide with propylene oxide using zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 as a catalyst

header.h1: Cycloaddition of carbon dioxide with propylene oxide using zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 as a catalyst
header.p:
Korean Journal of Chemical Engineering
volume
34
,
pages
928–934 (
2017
)
Cite this article

li.p:
322
Accesses

14
Citations

div.p:
Zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-23 was prepared and used as catalyst for the solventless synthesis of cyclic carbonate from CO
2
and propylene oxide with or without TBAB co-catalyst. ZIF-23 catalysts were prepared by a solvothermal or microwave method and they were characterized by various physicochemical techniques such as XRD, FT-IR, BET, TGA, and FE-SEM. The effects of reaction parameters such as temperature, reaction time, CO
2
pressure, and co-catalyst on the reactivity of catalyst were investigated. ZIF-23 was recyclable up to four times without any considerable loss of its initial activity. Reaction mechanism containing the role of ZIF-23 with TBAB co-catalyst was also proposed.

Download
to read the full article text
